additionalFields.subHeadline: Wayne Duso, AWS; Bob Blaney, Royal Bank of Canada; David Yi Mun, Royal Bank of Canada; Neelam Sandhu, BlackBerry Limited
additionalFields.description: Join Wayne Duso, Vice President of Storage, Hybrid Edge, and Data Services at AWS, as he delves into the innovative ways companies are using the power of AWS to revolutionize industries. Discover the latest advancements in infrastructure and data that can help you improve performance, optimize your IT spending, and achieve your goals faster. Whether you’re an established enterprise or a fast-growing startup, this keynote provides valuable insights into technologies such as machine learning and serverless computing, offering a comprehensive look at how AWS can help you stay ahead of the curve.
additionalFields.headline: Wayne Duso keynote

tags.name: Keynote
tags.description: Keynote Various Various Yes No

additionalFields.subHeadline: John Arnold, VIQ; Vahram Sukyas, VIQ
additionalFields.description: In this lightning talk, three small and medium-sized business (SMB) executives share their experience with AWS. They discuss the challenges they faced before migrating to the cloud, the benefits they have experienced since adopting AWS, and the lessons they have learned. They also highlight the AWS services they have used to improve operations, increase scalability, reduce costs, and enhance security. This talk is a great opportunity for SMB owners, IT managers, and decision-makers to learn from the experiences of successful SMBs and gain insights into how they can optimize their AWS infrastructure.
additionalFields.headline: Transforming SMBs with AWS: Lessons learned from real-world experience

tags.name: Customer Lightning Talk
tags.description: Customer Lightning Talk 15-30 min 3 Yes Yes *This session type to be discontinued/ combined with Lightning Talk after Summits 2023. This session type features a customer speaker.

additionalFields.subHeadline: Sanjeev Maddila, AWS
additionalFields.description: This session dives into Amazon.com and AWS supply chain and logistics strategies, including an overview of the digital supply chain strategy, Amazon’s global operations, the automation and scale of the supply chain, and Amazon’s fulfillment center strategy, including robotics. This session also takes a look at the complexity of producing and delivering equipment to global data centers. Building on this information, this session then provides guidance on how you can use AWS services to support the operation and forecasting of a digital supply chain.
additionalFields.headline: Learning from Amazon: Supply chain and logistics

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.subHeadline: Chance Lee, AWS; Rachel Leekin, AWS
additionalFields.description: As organizations grow and transform, it’s important to stay on budget and understand the cost of your workloads. In a Kubernetes environment, clusters are often shared by multiple applications or teams, which can present cost-management challenges. In this chalk talk, learn how to gain finer-grained visibility into the cost distribution of applications on Amazon EKS with a Kubecost demo. Also, explore how you can optimize costs with right-sizing, take advantage of flexible compute options such as Amazon EC2 Spot Instances, and use Karpenter to autoscale based on demand.
additionalFields.headline: Amazon EKS cost optimization

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.description: In this lightning talk, Anil Pillai, Vice-President of IT Infrastructure and Operations for Maple Leaf Sports and Entertainment (MLSE), details the migration and build-out processes for the MLSE hospitality and digital lab environment. Learn about the motivation for and execution of MLSE’s successful migration to AWS, including challenges they experienced along the way, how they used Amazon EKS to build a self-service platform with well-defined KPIs, and how they migrated mission-critical workloads. Discover how MLSE engaged with OpsGuru and AWS Professional Services to help with the high-profile migration using core AWS services like Amazon CloudFront, Amazon S3, and Amazon ECS. This presentation is brought to you by OpsGuru, an AWS Partner.
additionalFields.headline: MLSE unlocks innovation with migration to AWS (sponsored by OpsGuru)

additionalFields.subHeadline: Rahul Subramaniam, Aurea CloudFix
additionalFields.description: In this lightning talk, join Rahul Subramaniam, founder of CloudFix, to learn about his top three ways to save costs on AWS almost instantly. Learn how to achieve quick and repeated savings with AWS-recommended savings you can bank today to save every month. Discover how to easily automate cost savings based on recommendations from AWS. Learn how to empower your engineering team to safely cut costs by discovering what data can help, how to share it, and the right tools to empower FinOps and engineering to optimize costs together. This presentation is brought to you by Aurea CloudFix, an AWS Partner.
additionalFields.headline: Cost savings for AWS: 3 ways to save more now (sponsored by Aurea CloudFix)

additionalFields.subHeadline: Debashree Dasgupta, AWS
additionalFields.description: Amazon has a peculiar culture and approach to innovation that is intrinsically linked to how it uses technology. In this session, learn how Amazon innovates, organized around four interdependent elements: culture, mechanisms, architecture, and organization.
additionalFields.headline: Amazon’s culture of innovation

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.subHeadline: Kellie Burton, AWS; Bhasi Mehta, AWS
additionalFields.description: Organizations often use as many as four BI tools, including outdated reporting tools, to get value from their growing data. But despite continually investing additional resources, only 20% of decision-makers typically use BI to make day-to-day decisions. In this chalk talk, learn how to design a unified BI solution that consolidates interactive dashboards, natural language querying, embedded analytics, and paginated reports on a serverless architecture, significantly lowering your costs and delivering insights for everyone. Find out how you can deliver interactive data experiences and highly-formatted reports at scale from the same governed datasets utilizing an easy-to-use unified authoring experience.
additionalFields.headline: Unify BI and paginated reporting with Amazon QuickSight

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Peter Cherny, AWS; Schuyler Jager, AWS
additionalFields.description: Join this chalk talk to learn how to use Amazon Connect agent workspaces to improve agent productivity and serve customers faster and more effectively. Walk through Amazon Connect step-by-step guides and how to use machine learning capabilities like Customer Profiles, Wisdom, Cases, and Tasks to empower agents to better understand caller intent and needs. Discover how these capabilities can come together to solve common agent challenges, reducing handle time, improving first call resolution, and increasing customer satisfaction.
additionalFields.headline: Empower your agents with Amazon Connect agent workspaces and ML

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Kalpana Mahesh, AWS
additionalFields.description: Generative AI is a type of AI that can create new content and ideas, including conversations, stories, images, videos, and music. With generative AI on AWS, you can reinvent applications, create new customer experiences, drive higher levels of productivity, and transform your business. In this session, learn how to use generative AI for a range of tasks such as code generation, chatbot conversations, searching, and image generation. Learn how to choose from a range of popular foundation models, or use AWS services that have generative AI built in, running on the most cost-effective cloud infrastructure for generative AI.
additionalFields.headline: Building with generative AI on AWS

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.subHeadline: Jeramiah Dooley, AWS
additionalFields.description: Organizations increasingly run their applications as containerized microservices on Amazon ECS. This chalk talk shares best practices for how you can safely and quickly roll out new application versions with Amazon ECS. Discussion includes the various tools you can use for Amazon ECS deployments and safeguards you may wish to use, depending upon the application type and infrastructure provider.
additionalFields.headline: Best practices for deploying microservices on Amazon ECS

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Pierre Tessier, Honeycomb; Martin Yip, AWS
additionalFields.description: Amazon EC2 provides secure, resizable compute capacity in the cloud and makes web-scale computing easier. It is a foundational service for AWS and offers a wide variety of compute instances that are well suited for virtually every use case, from static websites to on-demand supercomputing, and it’s available with flexible pricing options. This session provides an overview of what’s new in the Amazon EC2 portfolio, including updates on capabilities, instance families, storage and networking functionality, and edge and hybrid offerings. Come learn how Honeycomb.io is leveraging AWS Graviton–based instances to reduce latency at lower costs and with fewer instances.
additionalFields.headline: What’s new in Amazon EC2

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.description: In these self-paced labs, practice your craft in a live AWS sandbox environment. In contrast to a simulation or demo, explore real-world cloud scenarios like spinning up a virtual machine or database, saving files to the cloud, and more with step-by-step instructions in the AWS Management Console. Try any of the 125+ self-paced labs on your own. Instructors are available for questions. Come and go as you please—labs take 30 to 90 minutes.
additionalFields.headline: Self-paced labs: Come and go as you please

tags.name: Labs
tags.description: Labs 60 min — All day 1 Yes No 1 speaker and 1 trainer to help with any questions in the room; Includes both Spotlight and self-paced labs

additionalFields.subHeadline: Rupinder Grewal, AWS; Dhawal Patel, AWS
additionalFields.description: In this chalk talk, dive deep into various model optimization techniques that help optimize costs and performance for hosting large generative AI models. Review techniques such as knowledge distillation, post-training quantization, pruning, compilation, model sharding, model server tuning, and many more. Walk through design patterns that help you select the right model optimization techniques for your use case to get the most out of your ML models on Amazon SageMaker.
additionalFields.headline: Optimize your large generative AI models for inference

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Shalesa Charron, AWS; Shaughn McCluskey, AWS
additionalFields.description: Hyper-personalized offers are becoming more common, and 70% of banks say that customer-centricity is a key priority. To address customer needs, banks can introduce new experiences, assist customers in the transition to digital and remote channels, and expand on digital use cases. In this session, learn how financial services customers are utilizing AWS AI/ML, Amazon Connect, and AWS Partner offerings to modernize their contact centers and deliver new products and services to their customers.
additionalFields.headline: Modernizing your contact center to grow your business

tags.name: Customer Lightning Talk
tags.description: Customer Lightning Talk 15-30 min 3 Yes Yes *This session type to be discontinued/ combined with Lightning Talk after Summits 2023. This session type features a customer speaker.

additionalFields.subHeadline: Roopesh Ramklass, AWS
additionalFields.description: Ready to migrate and innovate with your Oracle applications? Join this chalk talk to learn how AWS is helping customers move Oracle applications including E-Business Suite, JD Edwards, PeopleSoft, and Hyperion to the cloud to drive agility, innovation and new business insights. Join this session to learn more about architecture patterns and deployment options for running Oracle applications on AWS and how you can optimize Oracle license usage without compromising on high availability and disaster recovery.
additionalFields.headline: Running Oracle applications on AWS

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Jonathan Dion, AWS
additionalFields.description: As a technology professional with scripting experience and a new idea, building a frontend for a proof of concept or minimum lovable product may seem out of reach. In this lab scenario, your team depends on you to provision Linux instances for their use. You have already improved this process by writing an AWS Lambda function that launches Amazon EC2 instances with appropriate tagging. What if there was a web-based self-service tool that doesn’t require logging into the AWS Management Console? In this lab, build a serverless, full-stack single-page application with auth that allows users to launch and terminate EC2 instances.
additionalFields.headline: Spotlight lab: Frontend is for everyone

tags.name: Labs
tags.description: Labs 60 min — All day 1 Yes No 1 speaker and 1 trainer to help with any questions in the room; Includes both Spotlight and self-paced labs

additionalFields.description: In these self-paced labs, practice your craft in a live AWS sandbox environment. In contrast to a simulation or demo, explore real-world cloud scenarios like spinning up a virtual machine or database, saving files to the cloud, and more with step-by-step instructions in the AWS Management Console. Try any of the 125+ self-paced labs on your own. Instructors are available for questions. Come and go as you please—labs take 30 to 90 minutes.
additionalFields.headline: Self-paced labs: Come and go as you please

tags.description: Labs 60 min — All day 1 Yes No 1 speaker and 1 trainer to help with any questions in the room; Includes both Spotlight and self-paced labs

additionalFields.description: In these self-paced labs, practice your craft in a live AWS sandbox environment. In contrast to a simulation or demo, explore real-world cloud scenarios like spinning up a virtual machine or database, saving files to the cloud, and more with step-by-step instructions in the AWS Management Console. Try any of the 125+ self-paced labs on your own. Instructors are available for questions. Come and go as you please—labs take 30 to 90 minutes.
additionalFields.headline: Self-paced labs: Come and go as you please

tags.name: Labs
tags.description: Labs 60 min — All day 1 Yes No 1 speaker and 1 trainer to help with any questions in the room; Includes both Spotlight and self-paced labs

additionalFields.subHeadline: Jesse Gonzalez, Life360; Naveen Puvvula, Life360; Jamal Arif, AWS
additionalFields.description: Amazon EKS is a managed Kubernetes service that simplifies deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications on AWS and on premises. In this session, learn about Life360’s Kubernetes journey and how they use Amazon EKS for their location sharing, safety, and family tracking app, to serve millions of customers worldwide. Explore how Life360 uses a cell-based multicluster Amazon EKS pattern to have a statically stable resilient infrastructure, Karpenter as a flexible, high-performance Kubernetes cluster auto scaler, and a GitOps-based continuous delivery model to orchestrate multicluster deployments.
additionalFields.headline: Increase resiliency using cell-based Amazon EKS architecture

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.subHeadline: Spencer DeBrosse, AWS; Robert Fountain, AWS
additionalFields.description: Organizations of all sizes are looking for solutions that allow them to cost-effectively and securely empower end users in remote and hybrid work environments. Service teams at AWS are constantly innovating to deliver more functionality and improve the end user experience with AWS EUC services. In this chalk talk, learn what’s new with AWS virtual desktop services, application streaming, and secure browser services. Discover new Amazon WorkSpaces Family services and Amazon AppStream 2.0 features that provide enhanced security, improved performance, and innovative capabilities to an already rich end user experience.
additionalFields.headline: What’s new with AWS end user computing (EUC) services

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.description: In this lightning talk, learn how to use the power of high-performance low-code development and AWS cloud services to quickly and easily build and deploy complex applications. Discover how OutSystems, a leading low-code development platform, can help you rapidly create, test, and deploy an application on AWS, without traditional coding skills. Using OutSystems and AWS, you can take advantage of the powerful capabilities of cloud computing and low-code development to streamline the application development process and accelerate time to market. Learn how easy it can be to build sophisticated applications that meet the needs of today’s digital business environment. This presentation is brought to you by OutSystems, an AWS Partner.
additionalFields.headline: Accelerating application development with low-code and AWS services (sponsored by OutSystems)

additionalFields.subHeadline: Hahnara Hyun, AWS; Jeff Underhill, AWS
additionalFields.description: AWS Graviton processors are custom designed to enable the best price performance for a wide variety of workloads on AWS, including application servers, microservices, open source–based databases and in-memory caches, gaming, high performance computing, and machine learning. Tens of thousands of organizations are running production workloads on AWS Graviton. In this chalk talk, hear customers talk about their adoption journey, from benchmarking to running in production.
additionalFields.headline: Learning from developers who adopted AWS Graviton

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Aditya Samant, AWS; Sean Shriver, AWS
additionalFields.description: In this chalk talk, learn best practices for optimizing AWS managed databases for cost. Gain a deeper understanding of the key cost dimensions for Amazon Aurora and Amazon DynamoDB. Discover mechanisms like using a cache such as Amazon ElastiCache, Aurora I/O-optimized compute and storage, data tiering, AWS Graviton2-based instances, capacity reservations, and on-demand capacity to reduce costs while optimizing performance. Many of the techniques covered apply to additional AWS services like Amazon RDS, Amazon DocumentDB, and more.
additionalFields.headline: Simple techniques to cost-optimize your AWS database resources

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Augusto Valdivia, H.H. Angus & Associates Ltd.
additionalFields.description: This dev chat explores using infrastructure as code to create a scalable and resilient data lake architecture for collecting vast amounts of data in various industries. Learn how a mechanical and electrical engineering company used AWS to enhance their consulting services, create real-time monitoring dashboards for building performance, and use building information modeling to efficiently design spaces. Explore how AWS IoT Core can help data scientists analyze data effectively and learn about the benefits of using IoT devices to collect real-time data to drive insights and improve business operations.
additionalFields.headline: DevOps strategies for building scalable data lakes with AWS IoT Core

tags.name: Dev Chat
tags.description: Dev Chat 20-30 min 3 No Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: John Formento, AWS; Tarik Makota, AWS
additionalFields.description: With AWS, builders can create highly resilient workloads in the cloud. In this chalk talk, learn about some considerations for single-Region and multi-Region architectures. Walk through architectures that take advantage of AWS services with support for multi-Region capabilities and discuss what a failover scenario would look like in real life. The talk provides an understanding of what it takes to run multi-Region on AWS.
additionalFields.headline: Multi-Region or single-Region? Considerations and architectures

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: AJ Stuyvenberg, DataDog
additionalFields.description: This dev chat covers how to profile and visualize cold starts for your AWS Lambda functions and identify bottlenecks. Find out how you can use techniques like lazy loading to improve your function performance.
additionalFields.headline: Thawing your AWS Lambda cold starts

tags.name: Dev Chat
tags.description: Dev Chat 20-30 min 3 No Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Walter Angerer, Veritas
additionalFields.description: With cybersecurity threats increasing , it’s important to gain full control of your data and go beyond basic backups. Implement a data resilience strategy with unparalleled immutability, secure vault locations, cross-cloud anomaly detection, and non-disruptive recovery rehearsals, at scale. In this lightning talk, learn how Veritas provides secure, elastic, cloud-native solutions optimized for cost efficiency and rapid recovery when it matters most. This presentation is brought to you by Veritas, an AWS Partner.
additionalFields.headline: Secure, cloud-native & cost-effective: Veritas helps you take control (sponsored by Veritas)

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.subHeadline: Ahmad Muammer, AWS; Charlotte Wang, AWS
additionalFields.description: This session demystifies the holistic frameworks of the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) and cloud operating model (COM). Learn about presenters’ experiences and hear them break down these comprehensive frameworks into more understandable and actionable components. Through this simplified approach, you can gain a clearer understanding of how the AWS CAF and COM can be applied in real-world scenarios to help organizations transform their culture, technology, and business. Ultimately, the goal is to empower organizations to see the big picture and to accelerate their cloud journey through use of these frameworks.
additionalFields.headline: Demystifying the AWS CAF and cloud operating model

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.subHeadline: Russ Boyer, AWS; Blayze Stefaniak, AWS
additionalFields.description: Organizations are using data mesh architectures to create product offerings for their customers while centralizing security, governance, auditing, and data discovery. In this workshop, learn how AWS Transfer Family can automate the data processing pipeline for third-party data, validate the integrity of files transferred, apply PGP encryption and decryption and anti-malware scans, and enrich and load the data into a secure data mesh integrated with AWS Lake Formation. From here, the data can be securely accessed by your customers based on their role to search, query, and perform analytics. You must bring your laptop to participate.
additionalFields.headline: Build data mesh using AWS Transfer Family and AWS Lake Formation

tags.name: Workshop
tags.description: Workshop 120 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Jay Horne, AWS; Jorge Lopez, AWS
additionalFields.description: Organizations across the globe face considerable pressure to constantly raise the bar on performance and scale, all while keeping the cost of storing and using data as low as possible. Data is growing faster than ever, and organizations need a data architecture that helps them use their data cost-effectively and turn it into value. With AWS, you can store that data cost-efficiently and use it to power your decision-making. In this chalk talk, learn how you can maximize your performance while minimizing TCO with AWS storage services.
additionalFields.headline: AWS storage cost optimization best practices

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.description: In this lightning talk, learn how Portfolio+ has accelerated its pace of innovation in the open banking industry through engagements focused on digital transformation with OpsGuru. Hear from Steven Thomas, CTO of Portfolio+, and Robin Percy, CTO of OpsGuru, as they discuss how OpsGuru’s expertise helped realize Steven’s vision for a fully-automated, containerized, self-service platform using Amazon EKS—significantly reducing new customer provisioning lead time. Discover how the impact of this initiative was amplified with the migration and modernization of core IT and developer systems, and how OpsGuru’s Customer Reliability Engineering offering allowed Portfolio+ to focus its engineering efforts on product development. This presentation is brought to you by OpsGuru, an AWS Partner.
additionalFields.headline: Accelerating the pace of innovation in the open banking industry (sponsored by OpsGuru)

additionalFields.subHeadline: Rahul Subramaniam, Aurea CloudFix
additionalFields.description: Rahul Subramaniam, founder of CloudFix, manages over 40,000 AWS accounts, saving over $100 million for his company and other major enterprises. In this lightning talk, learn Rahul’s approach to applying the FinOps framework and his advice for building a cost-efficient culture, starting your practice without a big investment, and embracing automation. Learn how to scale AWS cost savings in your company, how to recognize the difference between savings recommendations and realizable savings, which tools can help with FinOps adoption and automation, and how you can break down organizational resistance. This presentation is brought to you by Aurea CloudFix, an AWS Partner.
additionalFields.headline: Lessons learned from automating $100 million in cloud savings (sponsored by Aurea CloudFix)

additionalFields.subHeadline: Mark Maurice, Lenme
additionalFields.description: In this lightning talk, Lenme’s founder & CEO, Mark Maurice, discusses his journey to build a successful and scalable peer-to-peer lending platform with AWS. Learn how Lenme made it possible for organizations to authenticate in seconds and for lenders to reduce lending risk by up to 80% using Lenme’s platform powered by AWS. Learn how Lenme uses Amazon Rekognition for identity verification, Amazon SageMaker for ML model building and training, and other AWS tools to streamline operations, enhance customer experience, and provide a scalable, secure, and high-performance lending platform.
additionalFields.headline: Revolutionizing peer-to-peer lending with Lenme and AWS

tags.name: Customer Lightning Talk
tags.description: Customer Lightning Talk 15-30 min 3 Yes Yes *This session type to be discontinued/ combined with Lightning Talk after Summits 2023. This session type features a customer speaker.

additionalFields.subHeadline: Steven Alyekhin, AWS; Vijay Niles, AWS
additionalFields.description: Are you developing generative AI models and need high performance while also lowering your costs? AWS Trainium and AWS Inferentia are ML accelerators purpose-built for large-scale deep learning. In this chalk talk, learn about a complete solution for training and deploying a text-to-image diffusion model. See how to easily compile the model, train it on Trainium, and deploy on Inferentia. Also look at benchmarks that can help you compare the price and performance delivered by these accelerators with other comparable Amazon EC2 instances. Finally, the talk includes a live demonstration of text-to-image generation working on Trainium and Inferentia.
additionalFields.headline: Train and deploy stable diffusion using AWS Trainium & AWS Inferentia

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Naranjan Goklani, AWS; Bill Ohlson, AWS
additionalFields.description: With the roles of cybersecurity leaders and CISOs both evolving into something more like a trusted business advisor, conversations around cybersecurity must also evolve. In this session, learn about the common challenges faced by cybersecurity leaders and discover tools leaders can use to elevate their conversations to the C-suite and board level—all while continuing to protect the organization from multiplying security concerns and meeting compliance and regulatory requirements. By addressing cloud challenges in a cloud-native way, cybersecurity leaders can gain trust, build relationships, show value, and demonstrate the confidence to operate workloads securely.
additionalFields.headline: Elevating the cybersecurity conversation

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.subHeadline: Faisal Aziz, AWS; Ankur Srivastava, AWS
additionalFields.description: Sourcing and accessing cloud software quickly and confidently is mission critical for many of today’s businesses. Organizations of all sizes must innovate quickly to stay competitive, and companies rely on hundreds of third-party solutions to help their teams succeed. But speed in procurement and provisioning can be difficult to balance with the need for governance of usage, cost, security, and compliance. In this chalk talk, explore how Canadian companies use AWS Marketplace for procuring third-party solutions, and learn how to better govern procurement workflows while gaining visibility into IT spend.
additionalFields.headline: Modernize and govern your digital supply chain in AWS Marketplace

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: David Hache, AWS
additionalFields.description: Developers, start your engines! AWS DeepRacer is the fastest way to get started with machine learning (ML). This workshop provides developers of all skill levels an opportunity to get hands-on experience with AWS DeepRacer to learn the basics of reinforcement learning, an advanced ML technique. Dive into the AWS DeepRacer console to build a reinforcement learning model for an autonomous driving application that is ready to race in under 90 minutes. Take your model from the classroom to the AWS DeepRacer League to compete for prizes and glory! You must bring your laptop to participate.
additionalFields.headline: AWS DeepRacer: Get hands-on with machine learning

tags.name: Workshop
tags.description: Workshop 120 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Prashant Agrawal, AWS; Gustavo Fernandes, AWS
additionalFields.description: Organizations need a log analytics solution that scales as their business grows and allows them to easily ingest log data for analysis. Join this chalk talk to learn how to quickly set up a serverless log analytics solution with Amazon OpenSearch Service and Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose that abstracts the management of your log analytics infrastructure away from you so you can focus on what is most important for your business.
additionalFields.headline: Log analytics with Amazon OpenSearch Serverless and Amazon Kinesis

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Sean Mee, OutSystems
additionalFields.description: Your IT team is under pressure to deliver new and differentiating digital products faster than ever. You’re not alone. Companies like Western Union, Humana, and Key Bank use low-code development platforms to transform and accelerate their software delivery and expand the value of their cloud investments. You can too. In this lightning talk, learn how building enterprise-grade applications on a high-performance low-code platform can help with some of your biggest business challenges—from agility to security and scale. Discover how to unlock the development and delivery of software for your unique business. This presentation is brought to you by OutSystems, an AWS Partner.
additionalFields.headline: Your business is unique: Build exactly what you need (sponsored by OutSystems)

additionalFields.subHeadline: Tom Godden, AWS
additionalFields.description: As organizations seek to accelerate cloud migration and transformation, some find themselves in situations where they have to manage IT operations in a multicloud environment, or they simply struggle with whether and how to adopt a multicloud strategy in the first place. Faced with many factors, leaders must consider how operating multiple cloud environments impacts business outcomes and their ability to innovate. In this session, the AWS Enterprise Strategy team shares unique insights and prescriptive guidance for navigating multicloud decisions and difficulties gleaned from thousands of engagements with leading organizations and extensive research into how multicloud impacts cloud adoption and transformation.
additionalFields.headline: Strategies for navigating multicloud decisions and difficulties

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.subHeadline: Susan St. Clair, Dynatrace
additionalFields.description: Organizations are spending too much time on manual and repetitive work due to the use of many monitoring tools, compliance challenges, and inconsistent, institutional knowledge-based approaches. To address this, DevSecOps teams must go beyond getting data on dashboards and drive automation in context to get answers from observability, security, and business data throughout the development process. In this lightning talk, learn how Dynatrace is delivering event-driven and workflow-based automation that proactively identifies problems before release and enables faster, more secure service deployments. This presentation is brought to you by Dynatrace, an AWS Partner.
additionalFields.headline: Secure and fast deployments with Dynatrace intelligent automation (sponsored by Dynatrace)

additionalFields.subHeadline: Jonathan Dion, AWS
additionalFields.description: As a network engineer, you are contacted by a client who cannot reach its website. The client has a two-tier web application in its AWS Cloud environment. The web application consists of two virtual private clouds peered together with the Application Load Balancer (ALB) nodes hosted in VPC-ALB and the web servers (targets) hosted in VPC-Target. In this lab, resolve the issue reported by the client by performing troubleshooting tasks.
additionalFields.headline: Spotlight lab: Resolve VPC routing conflicts

tags.name: Labs
tags.description: Labs 60 min — All day 1 Yes No 1 speaker and 1 trainer to help with any questions in the room; Includes both Spotlight and self-paced labs

additionalFields.description: AWS has invested in custom silicon to push the envelope on performance and price for demanding workloads like ML training and inference with AWS Trainium chips. Amazon EC2 Trn1 instances, powered by AWS Trainium chips, are purpose-built for high-performance deep learning training and offer up to 50% cost-to-train savings over other comparable GPU-based Amazon EC2 instances. Trn1n instances offer 1,600 Gbps of network bandwidth and are designed to deliver 20% faster time to train than Trn1 for large, network-intensive models. Join this session to learn how AWS Trainium and Trn1/Trn1n innovations, along with AWS, PyTorch, and Hugging Face collaborations, are benefiting users.
additionalFields.headline: How Meta accelerates deep learning workloads with AWS Trainium

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.subHeadline: Brian Beach, AWS
additionalFields.description: Developing software can be difficult and expensive. Throughout the software development lifecycle, developers need a way to easily identify and troubleshoot errors or defects in their code. In parallel, as the cost of detecting and fixing defects in software increases with time, software development managers need a unified console to triage software issues before they reach a production environment. This chalk talk outlines how developers can use Amazon CodeCatalyst to create a test plan for unit tests and code coverage and use dependency checks to help ensure code releases without vulnerabilities.
additionalFields.headline: Enhancing code quality with Amazon CodeCatalyst

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: James Bibby, Datadog
additionalFields.description: Every company is a technology company, and the pace of technological advancement—like the pace of business—is increasing rapidly. Today, a single web application can be comprised of a complex collection of interconnected services and applications. Operational and tactical capacity requires an understanding of this complexity. In this session, learn why visibility into how your systems are operating is important for organizations. Learn how observability can help you propel that understanding into true strategic capability. This presentation is brought to you by Datadog, an AWS Partner.
additionalFields.headline: Culture of observability (sponsored by Datadog)

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.subHeadline: Ryan Shaw, Dynatrace
additionalFields.description: As the AWS technology stack continues to evolve in order to meet demand and keep pace with the digital transformation of cloud-native enterprises, it is important that organizations using AWS have the observability needed to provide answers from data regarding today’s challenges and to future-proof for growth and adoption of AWS services to come. In this lightning talk, learn why observability into AWS environments is critical for architecting, building, and running performatively on AWS, and how Dynatrace provides insights that support ongoing optimization, efficiency, and innovation. This presentation is brought to you by Dynatrace, an AWS Partner.
additionalFields.headline: Accelerating AWS app modernization through intelligence and automation (sponsored by Dynatrace)

additionalFields.subHeadline: Schuyler Jager, AWS; Gerardo Vazquez, AWS
additionalFields.description: Join this chalk talk to learn about the fundamentals of networking using Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) and AWS Transit Gateway. In this talk, find out how you can design and build an Amazon VPC, including choosing and configuring IPv4 and IPv6 spaces, subnetting, routing, security, NAT, and more—and have your questions answered along the way. Then learn about different ways to connect VPCs to your on-premises environment using AWS Site-to-Site VPN and AWS Direct Connect.
additionalFields.headline: AWS networking fundamentals: Setting up your global network

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Diego Magalhaes, AWS; Rich McDonough, AWS; Clark Richey, AWS
additionalFields.description: Highly resilient workloads require a different approach than many applications. Architecting for resilience and observability creates a foundation that allows businesses to meet stringent availability requirements. In addition to architecture, businesses also need to have the proper strategies in place to achieve this high level of operational excellence. In this chalk talk, learn how resilience and observability work together and how AWS can help you build and operate the most critical workloads.
additionalFields.headline: Resilience and observability for modern applications

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Jack Huges, AWS
additionalFields.description: Prepare for the AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate exam in this one-hour study session. Review questions from the AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate official practice question set. Ask questions of the subject-matter expert leading the study session. This session is a great addition to the full bootcamp offered.
additionalFields.headline: Exam prep study session: AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.subHeadline: Sol Kavanagh, AWS; Alvar Torres, AWS
additionalFields.description: In this chalk talk, learn how to implement a strong foundation for your security practice on AWS. This talk is perfect for users that are migrating to AWS or that are already operating in the cloud but who would like to improve their security posture. From practical examples, find out how you can design, prioritize, and unblock security practices from the start, all while helping ensure that costs are monitored and optimized.
additionalFields.headline: AWS Security: The first 90 days

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Math Bruneau, AWS; Gerardo Vazquez, AWS
additionalFields.description: Amazon VPC Lattice drastically reduces the complexity and networking expertise needed to set up communication and discovery between services running on AWS. In this chalk talk, learn how VPC Lattice works with Amazon EC2, serverless, and containerized applications, and how it provides a secure connectivity option that reduces time spent for networking admins and service owners.
additionalFields.headline: Simplifying service-to-service networking with Amazon VPC Lattice

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.description: Are you AWS Certified but looking for a complex cloud project to help you practice building a real-world production cloud workload? AWS Community Hero Andrew Brown’s Cloud Project Bootcamp is a free 14-week program where you build a microblogging platform by architecting diagrams, writing bash scripts, implementing DevOps best practices, creating a CI/CD pipeline, writing AWS CloudFormation and AWS CDK code, creating a serverless pipeline, deploying containers to Amazon ECS on AWS Fargate, and implementing ML features. Leave this dev chat with an understanding of what the free Cloud Project Bootcamp is and how you can get started on your journey.
additionalFields.headline: Cloud Project Bootcamp guide

tags.name: Dev Chat
tags.description: Dev Chat 20-30 min 3 No Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Nayef Khan, AWS; Albeda Siddique, AWS
additionalFields.description: Many businesses use Amazon Connect to handle critical, 24/7 calls from their end customers. However, call volumes may be inconsistent, resulting in spikes or being too low to justify full-time agents. In this session, discover how calls can be transferred to agents in another Amazon Connect instance or even in a different time zone. Also, find out how end user information can be shared with the new agent during the transfer to prevent repeating and recapturing information already provided by the end caller. Learn how this approach can help businesses optimize costs and provide a seamless end user experience using Amazon Connect.
additionalFields.headline: Provide seamless customer care for global business with Amazon Connect

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.subHeadline: Fabrizio Napolitano, AWS
additionalFields.description: Unifying your data is a key first step to achieving analytical insights. But it can be difficult to build custom data management pipelines and code to prepare your data for analysis. Join this chalk talk to learn how AWS is making zero ETL a reality and integrating data services so that data flows from one system to another. Find out how you can perform analytics and machine learning without moving or transforming your data. Learn about Amazon Aurora zero ETL to Amazon Redshift, federated queries in Amazon Redshift and Amazon Athena, and the role AWS Glue can play in easier data integration.
additionalFields.headline: Understanding zero ETL with AWS analytics

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Hiren Chandiramani, AWS; Bimal Gajjar, AWS
additionalFields.description: Data is growing faster and is needed even faster. Files can be generated everywhere—in the cloud and on premises—and the value you can produce from your data is accelerating through predictive analytics, model training, and learned insights. Speed to insight, speed to change, and speed to new opportunities are important factors, and performance acceleration is a huge area of focus across the AWS storage portfolio. In this chalk talk, learn how you can improve performance with AWS storage services, and discover how AWS provides a reliable, scalable, and secure cloud experience for your data.
additionalFields.headline: Driving data performance using AWS storage and migration services

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.description: Imagine living with a lifelong condition where you needed to go to the washroom up to 20 times a day. For 300,000 Canadians living with Crohn’s disease or ulcerative colitis, this is a reality—and a daily challenge. Faced with anxiety, some choose to stay home but many cannot and must plan their activities around publicly accessible washroom locations. The GoHere Washroom Locator App helps people find the closest available washroom, anywhere in Canada. In this lightning talk, learn how Crohn’s and Colitis Canada used AWS services to bring this app to life.
additionalFields.headline: Improving quality of life with washroom access through the Go Here app

tags.name: Customer Lightning Talk
tags.description: Customer Lightning Talk 15-30 min 3 Yes Yes *This session type to be discontinued/ combined with Lightning Talk after Summits 2023. This session type features a customer speaker.

additionalFields.subHeadline: Leonardo Gomez, AWS; Mert Hocanin, AWS
additionalFields.description: As more users need data access and as data volumes grow, it’s important to have data governance policies, processes, and systems in place to ensure appropriate data handling throughout its lifecycle. Join this session to learn how data governance with AWS can help you balance data control and access to accelerate business insights. Learn how AWS is facilitating comprehensive data governance—from data preparation, integration, and data discovery to data quality, permissions, data sharing, and auditing—across our services, including Amazon DataZone, AWS Lake Formation, AWS Glue, and more.
additionalFields.headline: AWS data governance: Policies & processes for data control & access

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.subHeadline: Subhrajit Banerjee, Rackspace Technology
additionalFields.description: In today’s fast-paced world of cloud technology, IT professionals are faced with ever-changing dynamics and constant pressure to keep up with technological advancements. This can contribute to high levels of stress and burnout, negatively impacting mental health. This dev chat discusses effective strategies for handling workplace stress and building resilience, while also prioritizing mental health and well-being. From mindfulness techniques to communication and collaboration strategies, leave with practical tools that can help you navigate the challenges of the cloud industry and maintain mental and emotional balance.
additionalFields.headline: Cloud resilience: Navigating changes and cultivating mental health

tags.name: Dev Chat
tags.description: Dev Chat 20-30 min 3 No Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Aditya Samant, AWS; Sean Shriver, AWS
additionalFields.description: In this workshop, learn to build modern web applications at scale using purpose-built databases. Discover how to apply development patterns using Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon ElastiCache, Amazon Neptune, and Amazon OpenSearch Service to build a fully functional and scalable bookstore ecommerce application and dive deep into best practices along the way. It is recommended that attendees have basic familiarity with AWS concepts and services such as IAM, VPC, networking, and storage services. You must bring your laptop to participate.
additionalFields.headline: Build a web-scale application with purpose-built databases & analytics

tags.name: Workshop
tags.description: Workshop 120 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Julia Furst Morgado, Veeam
additionalFields.description: In this dev chat, learn how to avoid common AWS security, governance, and architecture challenges. Discover the most common mistakes AWS users make and explore practical tips for ensuring your infrastructure remains secure, cost-efficient, and scalable. Don’t let bad habits break your AWS environment!
additionalFields.headline: Breaking bad habits on AWS

tags.name: Dev Chat
tags.description: Dev Chat 20-30 min 3 No Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Brian Beach, AWS; Joe Cudby, AWS
additionalFields.description: Traditionally, building applications requires developers to spend a lot of time manually writing code and trying to learn and keep up with new frameworks, SDKs, and libraries. In the last three years, AI models have grown exponentially in complexity and sophistication, enabling the creation of tools like Amazon CodeWhisperer that can generate code suggestions in real time based on a natural language description of the task. Join this session to learn how Amazon CodeWhisperer can accelerate and enhance your software development with code generation, reference tracking, security scans, and more.
additionalFields.headline: Code fast with Amazon CodeWhisperer, a generative AI coding companion

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.subHeadline: Frank Ferlaino, Edsembli; Ben Schreiner, AWS
additionalFields.description: Moving to AWS in 2023 can bring many business benefits. According to an IDC report, businesses that migrated to AWS saw an average 51% reduction in infrastructure costs, 60% faster time to market, and 2.6 times more efficient IT operations. In this session, explore the catalysts and ideal time to migrate to the cloud; the tools, resources, and help available; and examples of organizations that are reaping the tangible benefits after migrating. Walk away with a better understanding of how the cloud helps optimize business costs, drive innovation, and achieve unparalleled scalability.
additionalFields.headline: Scalability, savings & speed: The AWS advantage for businesses in 2023

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.subHeadline: John Tuffin, AWS
additionalFields.description: This lab demonstrates how to build a fully managed continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipeline for applications that run on Amazon ECS. Use AWS CodePipeline to model, orchestrate, and visualize a three-stage pipeline that deploys a containerized application using a blue/green deployment strategy. This strategy launches a new version of the application that runs alongside the old version and then slowly shifts traffic to the new version. Blue/green deployments are commonly employed when performing in-place application upgrades. Administrators can use these to validate new code while simultaneously running the old application version.
additionalFields.headline: Spotlight lab: Create a CI/CD pipeline to deploy app to AWS Fargate

tags.name: Labs
tags.description: Labs 60 min — All day 1 Yes No 1 speaker and 1 trainer to help with any questions in the room; Includes both Spotlight and self-paced labs

additionalFields.subHeadline: Pallavi Nargund, AWS
additionalFields.description: Amazon SageMaker Canvas helps solve real-world challenges with no-code machine learning. In this chalk talk, walk through the main Amazon SageMaker Canvas features and some of the challenges it solves.
additionalFields.headline: Empowering business analysts with no-code machine learning

tags.name: Chalk Talk
tags.description: Chalk Talk 60 min 2 Yes Yes

additionalFields.subHeadline: Ayesha Bhutto, Datadog
additionalFields.description: Having a good observability strategy is critical for running applications in production, particularly in a microservices architecture. But what about serverless functions? What are the differences when it comes to monitoring, logging, and tracing for serverless workloads? How can you ensure that you’re getting the right data from your systems without compromising size and performance? This session introduces the topic of observability for a serverless architecture. Learn about the different tradeoffs that you should consider and the data points you should focus on to better understand your serverless architectures, with a face recognition serverless application used as an example. This presentation is brought to you by Datadog, an AWS Partner.
additionalFields.headline: Observability for serverless workloads (sponsored by Datadog)

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.subHeadline: Girish Arunagiri, AWS; Nashlie Sephus, AWS; Ritesh Vajariya, AWS
additionalFields.description: The seeds of a machine learning (ML) paradigm shift have existed for decades. Now, with the ready availability of scalable compute capacity, a massive proliferation of data, and the rapid advancement of ML technologies, organizations across industries are transforming their businesses. We’re at an exciting inflection point in widespread ML adoption where many customer experiences and applications may be reinvented with generative AI. Join this session to learn about generative AI, explore popular use cases, and delve into new AWS tools for building generative AI, including Amazon Bedrock, Amazon CodeWhisperer, and new Amazon EC2 instances powered by AWS Trainium and AWS Inferentia2.
additionalFields.headline: Transform your business with generative AI on AWS

tags.name: Breakout Session
tags.description: Breakout Session 60 min 1 to 5* Yes Yes *T&C Breakouts max is 1; General Breakouts is 3 w/ exceptions; Panels max is 5

additionalFields.subHeadline: Tariq Choudry, AWS; Aaron Fagan, AWS
additionalFields.description: Join this chalk talk for a quick overview of AWS Supply Chain features and capabilities, followed by an interactive question-and-answer session to dive deep and learn more. Learn how to ingest and harmonize data from across your supply chain and use that data to derive actionable insights to improve your supply chain resilience and performance. Also, explore other capabilities such as ML-driven demand planning, supplier lead time variance detection, and built-in collaboration tools. Join us and bring your questions!
additionalFields.headline: Questions about AWS Supply Chain? We deliver answers
